repnme.cdata!:
Kenya - Development of Housing, Water
            Supply and Sanitation in Nairobi

abstracts.cdata!:
This report aims to assess the
            effectiveness of the complementary interventions in the
            development of housing, water supply, and sanitation in
            Nairobi, as well as to understand their medium- and
            long-term impacts, i.e., five to fifteen years after
            completion. The study has drawn some key conclusions: 1) The
            projects helped support the rapid economic growth, and raise
            the standard of living in Nairobi throughout the last two
            decades. Particularly in the field of water supply and
            sanitation, the results are sustainable. On the other hand,
            although progress was made in developing housing programs,
            no lasting impact was achieved in terms of housing policies
            and cost recovery in the housing sector. In the area of
            institutional development, the Water and Sewerage Department
            of the Nairobi City Council serves as a good example of
            substantial achievements on effective capacity building. The
            report presents recommendations for future operations in the
            areas of sequencing of technical assistance and investment
            intervention, design of housing programs, and involving
            beneficiaries in project design and implementation.
